textStandardReferralRules:
When your referred friend buys or upgrades a Pioneer Pen, you can receive a 5% commission of the amount spent by the friend, which will be given as equivalent value in points. 
·If the number of valid friends reaches 30, the commission rate increases to 8%. 
·If the number of valid friends reaches 100, the commission rate increases to 11%. 
·If the number of valid friends reaches 500, the commission rate increases to 15%. 
·A valid user refers to a user who has bought a Pioneer Pen.
textParticipationPrizeCouponRules: When the coupon takes effect, you can receive a higher proportion of points from the Discussion Prize pool.
textWinPrizeCouponRules: When the coupon takes effect, you can receive a higher proportion of points from the Majority Prize pool.
textLikePrizeCouponRules: When the coupon takes effect, you can receive a higher proportion of points from the Likes Prize pool.
textInvestmentPrizeCouponRules: When the coupon takes effect, you can receive a higher proportion of points from the Support Prize pool.
textMysteryReferralRules:
How can you get a Mystery Box? 
 1. Every time you refer a friend who then signs up and logs in, both of you are entitled to a Basic Mystery Box. 
 2. If your friend buys a Level 3 SBT Pen, both of you are entitled to an Advanced Mystery Box. 

What rewards can a Mystery Box offer? 
 1. A Basic Mystery Box may offer [Participation Prize Coupon], [Majority Prize Coupon], [Like Prize Coupon] or [Support Prize Coupon]. 
 2. An Advanced Mystery Box may offer points or NFT Pens. 

What can a coupon do? 
 You can use the coupon on the [Rewards] page to increase your earning rate the next time you participate in reward sharing.
textMysteryBoxReferralSlogan: Get mystery boxes and NFT rewards

textNFTInvestmentDescription: The platform scans for the Genesis Pen held in each user's wallet every day at UTC 00:00, and takes a snapshot of each user's Genesis Pen for that day. The scan result indicates the point value that the user can support using the Genesis Pen on that day. Each Pen is worth {value1} points. Up to {value2} questions per day using Genesis Pen support.

textPrivateProgressDescription2: Popularity score of common questions = (Amount of the question's prize pool - Injected points) * [1+log10(Support amount+1)] * [1+log10(Injected points+1)]

textPenRuleBody1: You must own a Pen to participate in Socrates questions, available in two types: Pioneer Pen and Genesis Pen.
textPenRuleBody2: You can purchase a Pioneer Pen on Socrates. Confirm the level of the Pioneer Pen because you cannot upgrade it after purchasing. The higher the level of the Pioneer Pen, the higher the number of votes and earning coefficients.
textPenRuleBody3: You have the chance of receiving a Genesis Pen airdrop. Genesis Pens are rare assets with an equivalent number of votes and earning coefficient to an advanced Pioneer Pen. If you hold multiple Pioneer and Genesis Pens, the number of votes and earning coefficients can be added together. For more details, see Socrates' whitepaper.

titleBeginnerClass01: Beginner's Class 1: How do answer rewards work?
textBeginnerClass0102: There are two types of answer rewards for the Discussion Prize. An individual can only receive one type of reward when answering a question.
textBeginnerClass0104: Criteria: After choosing an answer, a user is ranked within the top 20 among the participants who answered the question.
textBeginnerClass0105: Eligibility for rewards: Assuming you chose A, at the end of the question, option A receives the most votes. Then you will receive an award along with other users who vote for option A.
textBeginnerClass0106: Reward coefficients: Based on the type and number of Pens (coefficients of Genesis Pens can be added together), the higher the level of the Pen, the greater the coefficient.
textBeginnerClass0107: Prize amount: Prize pool amount * 20/Total number of voters
textBeginnerClass0108: What is the Type 1 Discussion Prize?
textBeginnerClass0109: This type of reward is distributed relatively evenly, that is, all winners share the prize pool together, and the only thing that causes different rewards is the types of Pens held by each winner.
textBeginnerClass0111: Criteria: After choosing an answer, a user is ranked after the 20th place among the participants who answered the question.
textBeginnerClass0112: Eligibility for rewards: Assuming you chose A, at the end of the question, the percentage of option A compared with that when you voted for it has 2 possibilities: 1. Up; 2. Down (but not more than 5%). In both cases, you will be awarded a prize.
textBeginnerClass0113: Reward coefficients: Coefficient 1: Based on the type and number of Pens (coefficients of Genesis Pens can be added together), the higher the level of the Pen, the greater the coefficient. Coefficient 2: Based on the voting percentage increase of an option, the higher the increase, the greater the coefficient.
textBeginnerClass0114: Prize amount: Prize pool amount * (Total number of voters - 20)/Total number of voters
textBeginnerClass0115: What is the Type 2 Discussion Prize?
textBeginnerClass0116: 1. This type of reward features a larger difference in reward distribution and is more competitive. Apart from the factor that users hold different Pens, the more important thing is the voting percentage increase of the option you voted for when a question ends*.
textBeginnerClass0117: 2. You may receive rewards regardless of whether the option was the majority's choice or the minority's choice at the time of your vote.
textBeginnerClass0118: *At the early stage of voting, it's relatively easy to see a significant increase in voting when there are fewer participants. The closer the question is to the deadline, the harder it is to achieve the same increase. The algorithm introduces an additional voting stage coefficient to keep things balanced, ensuring that the calculation of the Type 2 reward is fair at any point in time.
textBeginnerClass0119: Next time, we'll explain the principles of the Reason Prize.

Textrankingvv1: This ranking is generated based on the total amount of points in the question's prize pools.

Textzuchenrr: The Genesis Pen is rare, and its earning coefficient is more than that of an advanced Pioneer Pen.
Texthighyoerrc: The prize pool is shared by users who are among the first {value1} voters and vote for the answer with the most votes. If the users are beyond the top {value1}, the higher the percentage increase of the answer they voted for, the higher rewards they will get. However, if the percentage drops by more than 5%, the users will receive no rewards.
Tedainhore: After users like a reason, the higher the percentage increase for the answer supported by that reason, the higher the ranking of that reason in terms of likes, and the more rewards the users get. However, if the percentage drops by more than 5%, the users will receive no rewards.
Textqin5verr: Only the top 5 reasons can receive the Reason Prize. The more likes the reasons receive, the more rewards the users get.
Textdanquisonvurc: When a common question becomes a trending question, all supporters will receive rewards. Those who support the question with a larger amount and at an earlier time will receive more rewards.
Textjialgcjwtcv: Rewards are given to the question creator. When a question becomes a trending question, the question creator will receive additional rewards.
TextOptionnumberFriend: With more votes, you'll be more likely to earn rewards. Invite your friends to vote now!
TextfollowGrandprize: Vote with your friends and win big!
textargumentgive: The more likes your reason gets, a higher chance of winning the Reason Prize. Invite your friends to like your reason!

TextSplitsupport1: Support the question into a trending question and share the Support Prize.

textquestionprize1: You can use points and Genesis Pens to boost popularity. If your supported question becomes trending, you'll earn the Support Prize.
textformulaillust: Popularity score = 150/[1+e^(-0.001*Number of voters)] + 500/[1+e^(-0.001*Total number of contributed points)] + 250/[1+e^(-0.001*Number of injected points)] + 100/[1+e^(-0.001*Number of injected points)]

bountyhintinforma: Bonus package will attract more voters, and the unclaimed bonus package will be returned when the question ends. Everyone can send a bonus package before the question ends, however, only one bonus package can exist at the same time period.
ordinaryillustrate: Eligible users will evenly share the bonus package, which will be distributed in real time once the conditions are met.
randomillustrate: Eligible users will randomly share the bonus package, which will be distributed in real time once the conditions are met.
Uniteillustrate: If the number of voters (including those who change their vote) reaches the set value, these users can share this bonus package. If the number of voters fails to reach the set value when the question ends, the bonus package will be returned to the user who sent it within one day.
timeillustrate: Voters (including those who change their vote) can claim this bonus package in real time. The unclaimed amount in the bonus package will be returned to the user who sent it right after the question ends.

airdroprankingComment: 4 million SOC, Socrates' first community incentive airdrop
airdroprankingillustrate: The Airdrop Ranking will be calculated from 11:00 a.m. on December 21 to 11:00 a.m. on January 21 (UTC+0). During this period, users will be ranked by your points earned on Socrates.
airdroprankingask: Your airdrop quota is determined by the proportion of the points you earn during the event. The more points you earn, the higher the airdrop rewards.
airdroprankingTips: Tips to earn more points and airdrops
airdroprankingTipscontent2: Always vote on questions, write down reasons, and support valuable questions to earn points.
airdroprankingTipscontent5: We will allocate 50% of the platform's Pen revenue to the prize pool of trending questions. Participating in trending questions or making your questions become trending may earn you substantial trending rewards.
airdroprankingTipscontent6: 3. Own a higher-level Pioneer Pen and Genesis Pens to increase your earning coefficient
airdroprankingTipscontent7: 4. Refer a friend to earn more rewards on Socrates
airdroprankingTipscontent8: Invite your friends to join the Socrates platform. When they purchase a Pioneer Pen or upgrade their Pioneer Pen, you will receive up to 10% referral commission. This not only helps your friends get better user experience but also brings you additional rewards.
airdroprankingTipscontent3: Create attractive questions to encourage more user interaction, thereby earning points as rewards.

textBindWalletDescription1: You can create a new wallet. After that, you can vote or like to win reward points. The service provider is magic.link
textSocratesNet: Choose a network to use with Socrates. Your choice cannot be changed once made.
textTrialNoPenNoReward: Questions you create are trial questions since you do not have a Pen yet. Trial questions would not become trending, and there are no rewards for participants. You may obtain rewards by creating paid questions with a Pen. When the paid questions become trending, you will also receive platform incentives.
textTrialNoInject: The questions you ask can be listed in the Vote Ranking and Question Ranking, and most question-related interactions do not cost points. However, you cannot inject points, customise the points required to interact, send bonus packages, or support questions. Your trial questions cannot become trending, and you are not eligible to earn rewards from the question.
textTriallWithPen: With a Pioneer Pen or Genesis Pen
textTrialSetReward: You can set a maximum of {value1} points that other users must contribute to interact with your questions, send bonus packages, inject points, and earn rewards from question's prize pools. If your question becomes trending, you will also earn additional rewards.
textTrialNeedPen: You do not hold any Pen yet, so the questions you create are trial questions. This feature is only available to users with a Pen.
textTrialCannotModified: The trial question cannot be modified once created. Continue?
textTrialLimit: A maximum of {value1} trial questions can be created every week. Please try again next week or create paid questions.
textTrialLimitVote: You can cast your vote on a maximum of {value1} trial questions every week. Please try again next week or vote on paid questions.
textWeb3NeedPen: In Socrates Pro, you must own a Pen and points to participate in questions there. You may earn high rewards and receive considerable bonus packages.
textWeb2NoPen: In Socrates Lite, you can participate in questions without Pens and points. However, you will not earn rewards.

textSwitchWeb2: In Socrates Lite, you can participate in questions without Pens and points. However, you will not receive rewards. Do you want to switch to Socrates Lite?
textSwitchWeb3: In Socrates Pro, you must own a Pen and points to participate in questions. You could earn large rewards. Do you want to switch to Socrates Pro?

textPointsBeHeld: Some points will be held for this question to reward the user who got the answer right. If no one answers the question or no one answers the question correctly, the points will be refunded. The number of points held equals the number of points required for participation multiplied by the reward rate of the question option.

textLeavePage: The transaction may take several minutes, and you can leave this page during the process. The Pioneer Pen will be transferred to your account after the transaction is completed.
text3Level: Pens are essential for participating in Q&A. Pioneer Pens have three levels, each with a different earning coefficient. Only the highest-level Pioneer Pen is displayed, and the number of votes and earning coefficient are based on the highest-level Pioneer Pen that a user holds.

textNFTcannotRedeemed: NFT points cannot be redeemed for crypto, withdrawn or transferred to others.
textNFTrule1: 1. All NFTs purchased from the Socrates marketplace and their subsequent rewards earned are subject to a 90-day lock-up period, but this will not affect the use of the NFT.
textNFTrule2: 2. If abnormal activities are detected after you purchase NFTs from the Socrates marketplace, your account might be frozen. If so, you need to contact customer service to unlock your account.
textCannotSoldnTransfer: A newly obtained Pioneer Pen cannot be sold and transferred within one hour.
